Intervention.evidence: The CAPAC platform consists of a tetrazine-modified sodium hyaluronate-based biopolymer injected at a tumor site, followed by one or more doses of a trans -cyclooctene (TCO)-modified cytotoxic protodrug with attenuated activity administered systemically.

Objective.evidence: To address this unmet need, we introduced a Click Activated Protodrugs Against Cancer (CAPAC) platform that enables targeted activation of drugs at a specific site in the body, i.e. , a tumor.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Finally, combined treatment with SQL70 and SQP33 (together called SQ3370 ) showed antitumor activity in a syngeneic tumor model in mice.

Harms.evidence: Pharmacokinetics studies in rats show that a single injection of SQL70 efficiently captures multiple SQP33 protodrug doses given cumulatively at 10.8-times the MTD of conventional doxorubicin with greatly reduced systemic toxicity.
